prompt: Can you help me build a skill for my team that automates our code review process? We use GitHub and have specific checklists we follow
baseline_response:
I can help you create a GitHub Action that can automate your code review process. Here's a template to get you started:

```yaml
name: Code Review Automation

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, synchronize, reopened]

jobs:
  code-review-checklist:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v3

      - name: Check PR Title Format
        run: |
          PR_TITLE="${{ github.event.pull_request.title }}"
          if [[ ! "$PR_TITLE" =~ ^(feat|fix|docs|style|refactor|test|chore)\(.+\): .+ ]]; then
            echo "PR title does not follow conventional commit format"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Check for Changelog Updates
        run: |
          if [[ ! -f CHANGELOG.md ]] || ! git diff --name-only ${{ github.event.pull_request.base.sha }} ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }} | grep -q CHANGELOG.md; then
            echo "Changelog should be updated with significant changes"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Run Code Quality Checks
        run: |
          # Add your specific linting and code quality checks
          npm run lint
          npm run typecheck

      - name: Run Unit Tests
        run: npm test

      - name: Check Test Coverage
        run: |
          COVERAGE=$(npm run test:coverage | grep "Lines" | awk '{print $3}' | sed 's/%//')
          if (( $(echo "$COVERAGE < 80" | bc -l) )); then
            echo "Test coverage is below 80%"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Security Scan
        uses: snyk/actions/node@master
        env:
          SNYK_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SNYK_TOKEN }}

      - name: Post Review Checklist Comment
        uses: actions/github-script@v6
        with:
          github-token: ${{secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN}}
          script: |
            github.rest.issues.createComment({
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              body: `
## Code Review Checklist

### Code Quality
- [ ] Code follows project coding standards
- [ ] Proper error handling implemented
- [ ] Appropriate logging added
- [ ] No hardcoded sensitive information

### Documentation
- [ ] Changelog updated
- [ ] Inline comments added where necessary
- [ ] README updated if needed

### Testing
- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Test coverage maintained
- [ ] Edge cases considered

### Performance
- [ ] No unnecessary computations
- [ ] Efficient algorithms used
- [ ] Potential bottlenecks addressed

### Security
- [ ] Input validation performed
- [ ] No potential vulnerabilities
- [ ] Secrets not exposed

Reviewers, please check off these items during your review.
`
            })
```

This GitHub Action does several things:

1. Checks PR title format
2. Ensures changelog is updated
3. Runs linting and type checks
4. Runs unit tests
5. Checks test coverage
6. Performs a security scan
7. Posts a comprehensive review checklist as a PR comment

You'll need to customize this to match your specific workflows:

Key Customization Points:
- Adjust commands like `npm run lint` to match your project
- Set appropriate test coverage thresholds
- Add/remove specific checks
- Configure any required secrets (like Snyk token)

To use:
1. Create `.github/workflows/code-review.yml` in your repo
2. Add necessary configuration
3. Ensure you have required scripts in `package.json`

Would you like me to elaborate on any part of this automation?
